Comments_List: This is a very interesting course, I have learned a lot about optoelectronics.
Understanding of the mechanism of opto-electronic process and devices.The ability to analyze the process in the LED and laser.
I learned how to think about science through an engineering lense, and how to approach graduate level physics courses.

During this course, I learned how to manipulate basic physical concepts in order to derive the equations that govern how a variety of photonic and optical electronic devices function. Additionally, I feel I gained a good conceptual understanding of how these devices work, and in which scenarios each device would be used in everyday life.
Optic fibers, LED, Lasers, Electro-optic modulation
This course is very hard. If possible, I hope professor Jung Han could talk more about the underlying physics, because derivation is too difficult to understand.
The content of this course is quite good and many typical devices and concepts in opto-electronics are included.

This course was very strong in developing both a mathematical and conceptual understanding of photonic and optoelectronic devices. Professor Han did a good job of extracting information from multiple sources and presenting it in an easy to understand way. One possible improvement I could see is to give supplementary materials for certain topics that are prerequisites for those coming in without an EE degree.
Cover lots of interesting topics, giving me insights into photonics
For students in the electrical engineering department, it is necessary and very useful to take this course.
Yes. I can get basic concepts in opto-electronics and explore more interesting parts in this area.
Yes, I would recommend this course to any student interested in learning about optical electronic and photonic devices.
giving fundamental ideas and theories of photonics.
